verses.verse: (For the choir director; on Muth-labben. A Psalm of David.) I will give<WH3034> thanks<WH3034> to the Lord<WH3068> with all<WH3605> my heart;<WH3820> I will tell<WH5608> of all<WH3605> Thy wonders.<WH6381>
I will be glad<WH8055> and exult<WH5970> in Thee; I will sing<WH2167> praise<WH2167> to Thy name,<WH8034> O Most<WH9411> High.<WH9411>
When my enemies<WH340> turn<WH7725> back,<WH268> They stumble<WH3782> and perish before<WH6> <WH4480> Thee.
For Thou hast maintained<WH6213> my just<WH4941> cause;<WH1779> Thou dost sit<WH3427> on the throne<WH3678> judging<WH8199> righteously.<WH6664>
Thou hast rebuked<WH1605> the nations;<WH1471> Thou hast destroyed the wicked;<WH6> Thou hast blotted<WH7563> out their name<WH4229> forever<WH8034> and ever.<WH5769>
The enemy<WH340> has come<WH8552> to an end<WH8552> in perpetual<WH5331> ruins,<WH2723> And Thou hast uprooted<WH5428> the cities;<WH5892> The very<WH1992> memory<WH2143> of them has perished.
But the Lord<WH3068> abides<WH3427> forever;<WH5769> He has established<WH3559> His throne<WH3678> for judgment,<WH4941>
And He will judge<WH8199> the world<WH8398> in righteousness;<WH6664> He will execute<WH1777> judgment<WH1777> for the peoples<WH3816> with equity.<WH4339>
The Lord<WH3068> also will be a stronghold<WH4869> for the oppressed,<WH1790> A stronghold<WH4869> in times<WH6256> of trouble,<WH6869>
And those who know<WH3045> Thy name<WH8034> will put<WH982> their trust<WH982> in Thee; For Thou, O Lord,<WH3068> hast not forsaken<WH5800> those who seek<WH1875> Thee.
Sing<WH2167> praises<WH2167> to the Lord,<WH3068> who dwells<WH3427> in Zion;<WH6726> Declare<WH5046> among the peoples<WH5971> His deeds.<WH5949>
For He who requires<WH1875> blood<WH1818> remembers<WH2142> them; He does not forget<WH7911> the cry<WH6818> of the afflicted.<WH6035>
Be gracious<WH2603> to me, O Lord;<WH3068> Behold<WH7200> my affliction<WH6040> from those who hate<WH8130> me, Thou who dost lift<WH7311> me up from the gates<WH8179> of death;<WH4194>
That I may tell<WH5608> of all<WH3605> Thy praises,<WH8416> That in the gates<WH8179> of the daughter<WH1323> of Zion<WH6726> I may rejoice<WH1523> in Thy salvation.<WH3444>
The nations<WH1471> have sunk<WH2883> down<WH2883> in the pit<WH7845> which they have made;<WH6213> In the net<WH7568> which<WH2098> they hid,<WH2934> their own foot<WH7272> has been caught.<WH3920>

The Lord<WH3068> has made<WH3045> Himself known;<WH3045> He has executed<WH6213> judgment.<WH4941> In the work<WH6467> of his own hands<WH3709> the wicked<WH7563> is snared.<WH5367> Higgaion<WH1902> Selah.<WH5542>
The wicked<WH7563> will return<WH7725> to Sheol,<WH7585> [Even] all<WH3605> the nations<WH1471> who<WH7913> forget<WH7913> God.<WH430>
For the needy<WH34> will not always<WH5331> be forgotten,<WH7911> Nor the hope<WH8615> of the afflicted<WH6041> perish forever.<WH6>
Arise,<WH6965> O Lord,<WH3068> do not let man<WH582> prevail;<WH5810> Let the nations<WH1471> be judged<WH8199> before<WH5921> <WH6440> Thee.
Put<WH7896> them in fear,<WH9252> O Lord;<WH3068> Let the nations<WH1471> know<WH3045> that they are but men.<WH582> Selah.<WH5542>
